roleset.name: (cause to) be in a vertical position

example.name: no agent
example.text: [On one side of this power struggle]-1 stand *trace*-1 the forces in ascendency on Wall Street -- the New Guard -- consisting of high-tech computer wizards at the major brokerage firms, their pension fund clients with immense pools of money, and the traders at the fast-growing Chicago futures exchanges.
example.arg: the forces in ascendency on Wall Street -- the New Guard -- consisting of high-tech computer wizards at the major brokerage firms, their pension fund clients with immense pools of money, and the traders at the fast-growing Chicago futures exchanges

example.name: with agent
example.text: John stood his toy soldiers against the wall.

roleset.note: Frames file for 'stand' based on sentences in financial subcorpus. Verbnet classes assuming_position-50, put_spatial-9.2-1, spatial_configuration-47.6.

example.name: they all look like this
example.text: The management group owns about 18% of the stock, most purchased at nominal prices, and would stand to gain millions of dollars if the company were sold.
example.arg: to gain millions of dollars if the company were sold

example.name: That is something up with which I shall not put
example.text: An undistinguished college student who dabbled in zoology until he concluded that he couldn't stand cutting up frogs, Mr. Corry wanted to work for a big company ``that could do big things.''

example.name: typical usage
example.text: An index of economic activity drawn from the survey stood last month at 47.6%;
example.arg: An index of economic activity drawn from the survey

example.name: financial
example.text: [The proportion]-1 that this stood for *T*-1 in the entire country's totalimport-export value rose from the previous year's 37% to 39%.
example.arg: in the entire country's total import-export value

example.name: correspondent
example.text: Gary Tuchman standing by in Chicago.

roleset.name: rise

example.name: by metaphorical extension... stand up for
example.text: And Dave did n't stand up for me .

roleset.note: Roleset corresponds to VN class assuming_position-50.

roleset.name: not show up for a date

example.name: both args
example.text: I mean I think it 's valid for you to yell at him-1 for *trace*-1 standing you guys up and stuff .

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on Call Home. No VNcls.

roleset.name: (cause to) back off, withdraw

example.name: arg1
example.text: I do n't think Nick Clegg should stand down .

example.name: all args
example.text: We've stood him down from training and playing until his court appearance on April 18, then we'll reassess
example.arg: until his court appearance on April 18

roleset.note: Added by Julia based on BOLT. No VNcls.
